identificationModule.briefTitle: Evaluation of Objective Pain Measurement Device
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluation of Objective Pain Measurement Device

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Chief, Division of Obstetric Anesthesia Department of Anesthesiology, Perioperative and Pain Medicine, Stanford University School of Medicine

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will attempt to objectively measure pain with an experimental device. The investigators will apply the device to measure patients "pain" due to uterine contractions during routine clinical care to correlate patients verbal pain ratings and analgesia requirements to that measured by the device. A brain oxygenation device, Edwards Foresight, will be used to concurrently to monitor brain oxygenation and hemodynamics, so the relationship between the CereVu ROPA device objective measure of pain and brain oxygenation/hemodynamic changes and patient-reported pain can be determined.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Despite all the progress in our understanding of the basic mechanisms of pain, the gold standard for measuring pain is still a subjective verbal numeric rating scale rating (0-10) obtained from the individual reporting pain. This method is not objective and cannot be used in all patient populations. This study will attempt to objectively measure pain in laboring mothers with a pain measurement device. The investigators aim to 1) see if the pain measurement device (CereVu ROPA) is capable of reflecting different levels of pain ratings in patients in labor having uterine contractions and then changes in pain after receiving different neuraxial techniques for labor pain and to 2) additionally determine the relationship between the CereVu ROPA device, brain oxygenation/hemodynamic changes and patient-reported pain scores.

armGroups.label: Part 1 Device Calibration
armGroups.description: 50 patients requesting epidural labor analgesia will have pain levels monitored during labor.

armGroups.label: Part 2 Device Validation
armGroups.description: 60 patients requesting epidural labor analgesia will have pain levels monitored during labor.

interventions.name: Pain Measurement Device
interventions.description: When participants request labor analgesia, the sensors of the pain measurement device (ROPA System \[CereVu Medical, Inc. San Francisco, CA\] and Edwards Foresight device) will be applied to the forehead and connected to the device. Data recording is then started.

primaryOutcomes.description: Average pain score obtained by device validated measure (higher scores correspond to more pain)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

primaryOutcomes.description: Average patient self-reported pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between pain score and brain oxygenation
primaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between patient self-reported pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain) and brain oxygenation (0-100%). This outcome will be assessed in part 2 only.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between pain score and noninvasive blood pressure
primaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between patient self-reported pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain) and hemodynamic parameter noninvasive blood pressure. This outcome will be assessed in part 2 only.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between pain score and heart rate
primaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between patient self-reported pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain) and hemodynamic parameter heart rate. This outcome will be assessed in part 2 only.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation between pain score and pulse oximetry
primaryOutcomes.description: Correlation between patient self-reported pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain) and hemodynamic parameter pulse oximetry. This outcome will be assessed in part 2 only.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During labor up to 2 hours after epidural

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to reach pain score 2 or less out of 10
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time taken for pain device score to be below validated value
secondaryOutcomes.description: Validated value is from the validated reading recorded by the sensor in the pilot study
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient reported pain scores after each contraction until 45 min after block
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pain score on 0 to 10 scale (higher scores correspond to more pain)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Device recorded pain scores for each contraction until 45 min after block
secondaryOutcomes.description: Device pain score validated measure (higher scores correspond to more pain)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dermatomal level at 45 minutes after block placement as a measure of sensory blockade level
Count of participants with block failures
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Count of participants with maternal side effects
secondaryOutcomes.description: Monitored maternal side effects will include nausea, pruritis, hypotension
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Count of participants with fetal side effects
secondaryOutcomes.description: Monitored fetal side effects include fetal decelerations early/variable/late
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Count of participants need Physician intervention
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within 45 minutes after the block placement

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age 18-50
* ASA 1 or 3 +/-E
* Patient requesting epidural labor analgesia
* Good toco tracing (clearly showing contractions at least every 5 minutes)
* Pain score greater than or equal to 3 out of 10 with contractions

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of chronic pain
* History of chronic opioid use
* BMI \> 45
* Allergy to sensor adhesive material, local anesthetic or opioids
* Contraindication to neuraxial block
* Patient on magnesium infusion
* Inability to give informed consent or understand English
